org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item

Class PRect

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.ReportItem
      • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.item.PRect

  • public class PRect
extends ReportItem
    Represents a graphical rectangle to be drawn in a Report. The width and height of the rectangle are determined by PRect.getHeight() and PRect.getWidth() Draws the rectangle using SimplePDF's rectangle methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PRect()
      Creates a PRect with height and width equal to 0.
      PRect(float width, float height)
      Creates a PRect with dimensions of width and height.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ReportItem enclose(float top, float right, float bottom, float left, ReportItem item)
      Encloses item within this PRect by creating a PGroup that contains both, and setting the width and height of this PRect to be just large enough to contain item's width/height plus the specified top/right/bottom/left padding values.
      ReportItem enclose(float padding, ReportItem item)
      A shortcut to enclose(padding, padding, padding, padding, item).
      ReportItem enclose(ReportItem r)
      A shortcut to enclose(0, 0, 0, 0, r).

    • Method Detail

      • setRounded

        public PRect setRounded(float offsetTL,
                        float offsetTR,
                        float offsetBR,
                        float offsetBL)
        Allows for rounded corners on the rectangle. The offsets should be the vertical & horizontal distance of each curve's endpoints from the corner of the rectangle.
        See Also:
        print(SimplePDF)

      • setRounded

        public PRect setRounded(float offset)
        A shortcut to setRounded(offset, offset, offset, offset).

      • setColor

        public PRect setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color using Java's standard Color object. This is passed directly to iText's BaseColor object. The color applies to both outlined and filled rectangles.

      • setColor

        public PRect setColor(com.itextpdf.text.BaseColor bc)
        Sets the color of the rectangle, both for fill and outline rectangles. The color applies to both outlined and filled rectangles.

      • setColor

        public PRect setColor(int red,
                      int green,
                      int blue)
        Sets the color of the rectangle, using red/green/blue values. Allowable values for each parameter are in the range of 0-255. The color applies to both outlined and filled rectangles.

      • getColor

        public com.itextpdf.text.BaseColor getColor()
        Obtains the color used to draw the rectangle.

      • setLineWidth

        public PRect setLineWidth(float lineWidth)
        Sets the line width, for use when drawing in outline mode.
        See Also:
        setOutline()

      • getLineWidth

        public float getLineWidth()
        Gets the line width of the rectangle.

      • setOutline

        public PRect setOutline()
        Causes the rectangle to be drawn as an outline, as opposed to a fill. PRect draws an outline by default.
        See Also:
        setFill()

      • setFill

        public PRect setFill()

        Causes the rectangle to be drawn filled instead of as an outline. A PRect's Fill and Outline properties are always opposites, i.e. one is false if the other is true. The default is Outline.

        To draw another ReportItem on top of the rectangle (such as text that should appear within it), always add PRect to a PGroup before the ReportItem that will be drawn on top of it, since PGroup draws ReportItems in the order they are added.

        See Also:
        setOutline()

      • setFill

        public PRect setFill(java.awt.Color color)
        A shortcut to PRect.setFill().setColor(color), for convenience.

      • setFill

        public PRect setFill(com.itextpdf.text.BaseColor color)
        A shortcut to PRect.setFill().setColor(color), for convenience.

      • setFill

        public PRect setFill(int r,
                     int g,
                     int b)
        A shortcut to PRect.setFill().setColor(r, g, b), for convenience.
        See Also:
        setColor(int, int, int)

      • getFill

        public boolean getFill()
        Returns true if the rectangle is to be drawn in Fill mode.

      • getOutline

        public boolean getOutline()
        Returns true if the rectangle is to be drawn in Outline mode.

      • enclose

        public ReportItem enclose(float top,
                          float right,
                          float bottom,
                          float left,
                          ReportItem item)
        Encloses item within this PRect by creating a PGroup that contains both, and setting the width and height of this PRect to be just large enough to contain item's width/height plus the specified top/right/bottom/left padding values. Works with both fill & outline PRects.
        Parameters:
        top - Amount of space to put between r and top of rectangle.
        right - Amount of space to put between r and right side of rectangle.
        bottom - Amount of space to put between r and bottom of rectangle.
        left - Amount of space to put between r and left side of rectangle.
        Returns:
        A ReportItem containing both the PRect and the item to be enclosed by it.

      • enclose

        public ReportItem enclose(float padding,
                          ReportItem item)
        A shortcut to enclose(padding, padding, padding, padding, item).

      • enclose

        public ReportItem enclose(ReportItem r)
        A shortcut to enclose(0, 0, 0, 0, r).

      • print

        public void print(SimplePDF pdf)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Prints this PRect using SimplePDF's rectangle drawing methods as appropriate, depending on fill vs. outline and rounded vs. square corners.
        Specified by:
        print in class ReportItem
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        SimplePDF.drawRect(float, float), SimplePDF.fillRect(float, float), SimplePDF.drawRectRounded(float, float, float, float, float, float), SimplePDF.fillRectRounded(float, float, float, float, float, float)
